name: White Devil - Yeppoon CD
description:
White Devil formed in July 2012 by three like minded garage punk reprobates when Sweet Willy returned to his hometown after being deported from a country we will leave unnamed. Cowboy Bob and Satan were just kickin around and thought we should get drunk together and cockblock their friends. Cowboy Bob has served time in Lobster Prophet The Vaginabillies pineapple from the dawn of time and was tiring of the psychpunk he was known for, Satan used to drum for brisbanes 90's degenerate's Strutter and Sweet Willy was behind The Standing 8 Counts and the london based Peoples revolutionary choir and new yorks A Place to Bury Strangers. But this band sound nothing like any of them Yeppoon comes off like a cautionary tale from the tropics put through Sonics rendezvous and the New Christs with a bit of Chambers Brothers on the side.

Tracks
Theme/Black snake Moan
Dog in a bathtub
Yeppoon
Slowboat to Indonesia
action Jackson
Str8 To your Heart
Godzillas back
Ride Up on By

name: Fat - Blue Meets Black CD
description:
Fat have existed in brisbane on and off for over 20 years. From their humble nude beginnings in Vans outside of rural QLD towns to absolutely killing it at the legendary turkeyneck Xmas party last december. This new album was recorded over most of 2012 at the Brand new La La Land studious set in the hinterland bush of logan. It comes out like a bizarre cross between SST noisepunk and swirling guitar lines bass heavy psych hate jams.

Tracks.
1. 90 Times a Day
2. When Michael jackson died.
3.Anxiety
4.Blue meets black
5.Whens it gonna rain
6.I cant sleep 
7.Please Not today
8.The Queen is dead
9.Security
10.Goodbye Good luck
11.Take it or leave it
12.Freeway

name: Some Jerks - Buddy Rich Made Me Cry CD
description:
TN.29 Some Jerks - Buddy Rich Made Me Cry CD

Brisbanes favourite girl surf three piece are back with a ball tearer of a debut album. Buddy Rich Made me Cry was recorded in Clayfield with Skritch at the helm and Mastered by Shellac's Bob Weston . 11 Tracks of pure surf pop bliss with an additional cover of an early Suzy Quatro band What a Way to Die. Victoria and Will really play well off each other vocal strong points  as a perfect compliment to the reverb drenched surf garage.

Track List

2. Waiting for you
3. Buddy Rich Made me Cry
4. Silver Star
5. Never Know
6. Penny For your Heart
7. I want you 
8. Go My Way
9. Go

11. What a Way to Die

name: Meatbeaters "Crusty Seamen" CD
description:
The 2nd full lengther  for these adelaide troublemakers and their first on turkeyneck. From the great aussie tradition of foul mouthed pub punk rock. With  a fucked up sense of humour and a heavier than all balls out rocknroll. The sound guys project comes from a long line of aussies from Rose tattoo and X to the Powder monkeys Bored and the Cosmic Psychos. A must for fans of the above.

Track List
1. Misunderstood
2. Cracking Skulls
3. Lunch
4. Heaven and Hell
5. I Walk Alone
6. Ute
7. Big Momma
8. Fuel Injected Fist

name: Screamin' Stevie - Mamma Didn't Want Any Fruit CD
description:
The fourth album in as many years from Brisbane's homegrown Cape wearing maestro of Garage Soul. Mamma didn't Want any fruit delves into a more bluesy gut bucket territory mixed with a Stonesy early seventies swagger and an australian garage pop sensibility. His previous band australia left during the making of this and had to be replaced to complete the album. Thoughtfully produced by Guitarist Brian Mann, he has managed to produce a solid yet crisp piece of finely crafted uniquely  australian rocknroll.

Track List
1. Mamma Didn't want any fruit
2. Funny Feeling
3. I Don't Want you no More
4. Playing Rocknroll
5. Dynosaure
6. Clean
7. Altitude
8. Parking Lot
9. Freeda
10. You Can run

name: Blowhard - Five Minute ride Through Hell (Best Of) CD
description: TN.21 Blowhard 5 Minute Ride Through Hell CD Brisabane's Blowhard formed in a practice room in July 1989, from the ashes of Bad Ronald and New Improved Testament and played their first show the following early september '89. Blowhard shift from their early rawkus punkrocknroll to skapunk to jazzy hardcore in the late 90' to early 00's.All laden with antipodean humour and whit. This compilation "5 Minute Ride through Hell" encompasses all parts of their recorded career from 1990 to 2001 including the early single recordings through debut album "Blowin Off" to fan favourite "Hornbag" and later era "Toxic Swing". Many live favourites are here including V8 RocknRoll, Hey Taxi, Fat Juicy Cop, Big One and Teenage Girlfriend with the marvellous Fred Negro. "5 minute Ride through hell" also features an extensive 16 page booklet full of liner notes, pictures magazine articles and flyers. TRACK LIST 1. Big One 2. Tully and Ren 3. Shutterdown 4. Bullshit 5. Herbal Boy 6. Poo 7. Ben's One 8. I'll Polka Your Eyes Out 9. Shitload 10. I'm Broke 11. Hey Taxi 12. V8 Rock 'n' Roll 13. Sexual Dv8 14. Teenage Girlfriend 15. 5 Minute Ride 16. Lovegrind 17. Toxic Waste Bop 18.Vampire Love 19.Tweedle Dee 20.Whole Worlds Stuffed 21.My Truck Won't Start 22. name: They Might Be Vaginas - Fourftfuck 7"EP
description:
TN.01 They Might Be Vaginas "fourftfuck" 7"ep
Debut release for turkeyneck and TMBV, this four track 7" is a rude crude and stupid as can you can hope for, from the the opener Dwarf fuckin to the to the pastiche of No Eye Dear's wife-slaying william tell overture It does not disappoint especially if  high hopes are not for you . Musically its sort of  like a hyped up Child Molesters mixed with a little rural Nine Pound Hammer. These guys also appeared on Swedish label Tickled Crippler's "No shit its the GG Allin and the Jabbers tribute" album doing the GG Allin classic Bored to Death. Released in 2001 with a fantastic cover by the one and only Fred Negro. This ep set a trend of lo-fi offensive punkrock'n'roll for turkeyneck to follow.


Track List
01, Dwarf Fuckin
02. Momma Done Left Me (In a Garbage Bag)
03. Party Of Five (in my Underpants)
04. No Eye Dear

name: I Spit on Your Gravy - St Kildas Still Alright CD
description: TN.03 I Spit on Your Gravy St Kildas Still Alright CD Turkeyneck Records is proud to release for the first time on Cd. The 1984 classic mini LP "St Kildas Alright" from these legendary St Kilda Pranksters.Re-mastered and re-packaged and includes the Eat Your Head compilation tracks and previously unreleased live tracks from the Esplanade Hotel.16 page booklet includes fanzine interviews posters cartoons and reviews from the time of release. Artwork by Fred Negro. Track List 01.Thursday Crawl 02.Let's Go Buy 03.Catholic Song 04.Chainsaw Shuffle 05.The Goink 06.Alright Peter 07.Violent Fluff 08.Done To Death 09.What's Happening? 10.Harrassment 11.Piranha 12.I Spit On Your Gravy

name: Meatbeaters- "Carry on Tuggin'" CD
description:
Paying attention? This album by a band from local serial killer capital Adelaide that hardly anyone outside Australia will have heard of celebrates obscene volume, filthy guitar sounds and a blaring bottom end. For these reasons alone, you should love it.

The Meatbeaters still dress like homicidal Water Buffalo Lodge members wandering out of the pub after commiserating about their failure to pass the basic skills test at the local basket-weaving workshop. They make a noise that's rude and crude enough to blow your average Danzig T-shirt-wearing would-be thrash band right up a dead elephant's arse and out the other end.The Meatbeaters are unashamed fans of the Powder Monkeys, the Tatts, the Onyas and the Cosmic Psychos. The dirty stuff. Each of their songs burn with the same intensity that all of those bands delivered. Then they drop in a good dose of carnal humour, a trait they share with fellow Oz yob rockers the VeeBees and a long line of precursors.This is smart-dumb rock and roll with its three big chords locking horns with dark clouds of electrified energy blowing in off the Great Southern Ocean. Every man for himself and lock up your sister with the braces and cleft palate."Name Of The Father" entwines Sonic Smith's fifth notes solo with scalding rhythm guitar. Whoever plays lead on these songs (Kid Ock or vocalist Slammin' Stan - or maybe they share the role) invariably drills rather than thrashes. The playing's tight and doesn't leave many spaces. If it did it probably wouldn't leave you with bleeding ears.The Meatbeaters' assault is hard and relentless. Only "Slappin' My Balls" varies the formula with a bass intro ushering the guitars in before the Beaters lock into formation. They take it down and build it back up with Slammin' Stan wailing away righteously on vocals in the middle of a guitar ebb tide.One of the band members emailed to find out if the CD had made it through the lucky dip that is Australia Post and if it passed muster. My reply of "it's a motherfucker" prompted the response: "Is that good?" I certainly hope so.Even with its paucity of lighter moments, "Carry On Tuggin'" never wears thin over the course of 37 minutes, Motorhead fans take note. And The Meatbeaters' ragged take on The Wipers' "Over The Edge" (the only cover) might even shade the original. - The Barman 194bar)

Track List
1.6 Foot 8
2.Name Of The Father
3.Killer In The Night
4.Snow Dropper
5.Spit Roast
6. Fingered
7.In My Hand
8.Pussy Crumbs
9.Slappin' My Balls
10.Over The Edge

description: TN.10 The Band Who Shot Liberty Valance "Outlaw Death Lager Drinkers from Hell" CD Turkeyneck is pleased as punch to be rereleasing this Melbourne Country Punk gem. THE BUSYMEN LONELY DOG 7”EP Wild Eagle Records

name: Dangermen-  Summer of Danger CD
description:
DANGERMEN- SUMMER OF DANGER
A four piece Rock n Roll band from Brisbane, Australia, The Dangermen formed in August 2001 and in their five years together have played over one hundred and fifty live shows up and down the East Coast of Oz. BIn 2002 they released a 7 inch single through Brisbane’s Wild Eagle Records containing the seminal tracks Gotta Be and Mechanical Girl. The Dangermen have also had tracks included on Turkeyneck Records’ Drunks, Guns and Livestock in the Streets Vol 2 compilation, an Off The Hip Magazine CD sampler, a PBS FM compilation of live to air performances, and most recently on a CD Sampler accompanying Carbon 14 magazine entitled Monsters of Australian Rock, also featuring tracks by Radio Birdman, the Drones and the Busymen. In 2004 The Dangermen released their debut 12 track CD “Summer of Danger” on Wild Eagle Records to positive reviews comparing The Dangermen to bands such as Radio Birdman, the Saints, the Stooges and the Lazy Cowgirls. Tracks from the album received airplay on independent / underground radio stations in Australia as well as the U.S.A. and Europe.Their live shows are frenetic, often teetering on the edge of total destruction, but The Dangermen have an uncanny knack of harnessing the maelstrom to deliver a brutal onslaught of sonic Rock n Roll! Sporting songs influenced by bands such as Bored!, the Sunnyboys, the Who, Turbonegro and the Rolling Stones it is not unlike a glorious night out on the tiles that you never want to end, full of adrenalin fuelled thrills and spills. 
TRACK LIST
1.Shipwrecked
2.Gotta Be
3.Shark Attack
4.Put It on Your Fridge
5.Show Me
6.Summer of Danger
7.Johnny Craig
8.Mechanical Girl
9.Instigators
10.This Is Not A.M. Radio1
11.We Are the Dangermen
12.Supersonic Meltdown

description:
TN.25 Shrewms
Brisbane Doghouse CD
ShrewmS always impress with their live shows and are rarely contained to the stage… a rule that even applies to the drummer, who doubles as lead singer/front-man and wears a fucking motorcycle helmet. a bass player with a leather vest fetish and one kick arse lead guitarist in the good son Julien.Drawing influence from australian thuggish punkrock like the Powder Monkeys X Cosmic Psychos Bored! to Devo and Guided By Voices. 2011 brings the debut full lengther Brisbane Doghouse with its 11 tracks of ferocious dual guitar garage gutter punk.

name: Crackwhore - self-titled CD
description:
TN.06 Crackwhore 
self-titled CD
Bred from the bowels of Melbourne, CrackWhore deliver nice and sleazy rock n roll. and Turkeyneck are proud to release there debut 10trk platter. Sophisticated garage rock played to excess, an alternative to tight black jean motherfucker art fags. Dirty Rock with a garage punk influence, growing up tough in the school of hard knocks drawing inspiration from the Divinyls, Souxsie Soux, the Dead-Boys, the Stooges and maybe some Nancy Sinatra too. This release also includes a ball-tearing cover the Divynls "Boys In Town”

name: Screamin Stevie's Australia- She Just Likes to Dance CD
description:
TN.27 Screamin' Stevie's Australia.
She Just Likes to Dance.
Brand new album from brisbanes premier cape wearing organ weilding madman Screamin Stevie. Having taken time off from the tip to create this masterwork Stevie and his always evergreen band Australia have really nailed it. Produced by guitarist Brian Mann in his own studio on the southside of Brisbane. The results are amazing it takes in the scope of Stevies garage stomp and couples it with the hooks and sound of real australian rocknroll ala sunnyboys/stems and the like. Surely will be the brisbane album to end all albums. Available Now

Track List

name: The Busymen - Distort All Levels CD
description:
TN.08 The Busymen 
Distort All Levels CD
Formed in 1997 the Busymen have been spellbinding audiences with their singular take on 60s punk and rock & roll. They combine beat, proto-punk, blues and feedback and you can dance to it. The band cut their teeth in Brisbane’s gutter rock scene of the late 90s which included bands like Strutter, Big Bongin Baby, the Hekawis, Standing 8 Counts and the Cool Millions.The stage presence of unique vocal stylist "Boston" Bob Smith (maracas, tambourine, kung fu) is often cited as the key element to the Busymen's live reputation. Yes they are better live, but even better if they show up

name: Various Artists-Drunks Guns and Livestock in the Streets CD
description: TN.02 Various Artists-Drunks Guns and Livestock in the Streets CD Subtitled “Live at the Turkeyneck Bar & Grill 1979-2001”, this comp collects some of Australia’s most notorious punk/garage from the old school (X, Cosmic Psycho's, I Spit On Your Gravy) to the new (The Standing 8 Counts, The Dirtcatchers, The Fred Band). All live from from a dive reportedly North of St Kilda and west of Rockhampton. Extensive liner notes from a former Manager who expains how the strippers went bust when they took two dollar notes out of circulation and many other tales of violence and stupidity from the aforementioned shit hole. There are many unreleased and unavailable  live gems throughout this slice of australiana. Track List 1.  X - That's not nice 2.  The HYMIES - Dockside 3.  The BAND WHO SHOT LIBERTY VALANCE - You can't speak to me like that 4.  The DIRTCATCHERS - Big tits Big cnt 5.  SCRUMFEEDER - Trucky Powder 6.  CORPSE GRINDERS - Hey little Girl 7.  The STANDING 8 COUNTS - CAN'T BACK DOWN 8.  THEY MIGHT BE VAGINAS - Dr Schiplitz 9.  COSMIC PSYCHOS - Dead Roo 10. Surf Lounge Exotica extravaganza featuring the talent of one Mr Phill Wilson. Chucknee’s uber lord and master of ceremonies. This album is the culmination three different Chucknee lineups firstly the surf exotica type they normally would employ in a live band setting.The second is a fourteen piece polka band  and  the third is dreamy cantonese psychedelica. A majority of vocals were by Rollo from Brisbane Punk institution Blowhard. Other players on this album includes Members of Godnose SixftHick Blowhard.

name: Kamikaze - Crash, Burn and Bleed. CD
description:
tn.12 Kamikaze 
Crash Burn and Bleed CD
Kamikaze are Adelaide’s very own olympic standard rock’n’roll pentathalon. They combine the crash’n’burn mentality of the original Japanese suicide squads with the mystic rites of the amusement parlour & travelling circus, and then infuse it with a massive dollop of equal parts no-holds-barred old school rock’n’roll, rama-lama punk rock depravity and schlock horror movie sensibility. This is not just some cross-over hybrid of clashing musical styles, but the real deal.

tn.13 Shonkytonk
I Can’t Believe it’s Not Butter CD
This release was released back in 1998 independently by the Shonkytonk and disappeared after just one pressing. This is one of Australia’s  lost country gems featuring the one and only Fred Negro (I Spit On Your Gravy) along with Dave Moll (Harem Scarem) and  several other St Kilda personalities. Covering Jonathan Richman Roger Miller George Jones and Hank Williams Jr. Flawless country.

name: Lobster Prophet - Tropical Alien CD
description:
TN.15 Lobster Prophet 
Tropical Alien Mini CD
Direct from the BP oil filtered wilds of the Great Barrier Reef Lobster Prophet deliver up their debut offering "Tropical Alien" for Turkeyneck Records. With members of the Boondall Boys, Dangermen and Kamikaze coming together to mould 8 tracks of drug addled hateful Psychedelia paying homage to acid damaged Texas heroes the Butthole Surfers and the Thirteenth Floor Elevators. The Lobster's impressive duel guitar tapestry is met by a thunderous rhythm section and paranoid vocal whit that suggests they've lost their minds! Pick this one up and check em out live before they all end up in the psych ward....

description:
TN.16 Gravel Samwidge
Nonchalance CD
Gravel Samwidge started in Sydney in 1989 playing with bands such as Lubricated Goat, Munroe's Fur, King Snake Roost, Tex Perkin's Butcher Shop before relocating to Melbourne in 1990.  Based in Brisbane at the moment the band is continuing to play live. The Debut full length album Nonchalance was recorded at Zero Interference in Bowen Hills. Big noisey Black Eye guitar rock with smatterings of vintage synths and screwball guitar.

Some jerks debut self-titled 5 track EP comes across like the garage love child of the Cramps & Blondie.
From the  shout pop of “Don’t Break My Heart”, & the wall of melody
that is “Walk With Me”, through the groovy garage epics of “Heart Of Coal” & “So Long”, to the fist pumping coolness of “Climbing The Walls”..... Some jerks sure know how to write some blistering pop hooks.Available Now

description:
TN.23 Bertie Page Clinic
Rock & Roll in a G-string
Bertie Page Clinic is the perverted child of burlesque and garage rock. Australian Cabaret star Bertie Page heads up this wicked little band of retrograde rockers. This punchy tracks are a collaboration between Miss Page and Phill Wilson (Chucknee and founding member of Blowhard). This garage punk band combine the best elements of glam rock, punk rock and Trash rock, pulled off with a T. Rex/Alice Cooper bent.

description: TN.22 Jim Rockfords Moving At The Speed of Sound CD Turkeyneck is proud to present you the future of the Bar Band."The Jim Rockfords" debut 11 track album "Moving at the Speed of Sound" is hard edged R'nB' tinged garage punk. With a swag of songs full of regret, loss and booze filled redemption. This is maximum rnb crossed with boogie boogie heaviness, think Coloured Balls mixed with the Supersuckers. Led by the all singing' all harmonica slinging reprobate Junior Hickey and his cast of brisbane barflies. Track List 1. Love You to death 2. Tail Lights 3. Speed of sound 4. Putty in your Hands 5. She's On Fire 6. Dead Mans Boots 7. Have you Seen My Baby 8. Whipping Post 9. PostCard 10. Temptation 11. Stay Out Late

name: Screamin Stevie and the Credit Union - Four Flights Up CD
description:
TN.09 Screamin’ Stevie and the Credit Union 
“Four Flights Up” CD
This is a reasonably new combo kicking around the local brisbane dives. Featuring Screamin Stevie Zillman on Singin, Organ and Harmonica. Formally from Bris/Melb garage stalwarts the HEKAWIS. Screamin Stevie has assembled one tight little garage rock combo behind him with two guitarists bass and drums. This album covers everything from Women to Acid and all the paranoia's associated with the two. This is organ drivin' madness at its best! Great songs with wailing guitars and flawless back up harmonies. Led by a man in a cape the one and only Screamin' Stevie. Original Art By Rod Mcleod

Track List
01. 4 Flights Up
02. In the Band
03. Make It on Time
04. If You Don't Care
05. Tribute to Dell
06. One Look
07. Black Negro
08. Still Life
09. What the New Breed Say
10. Who Told All the Lies

name: Screamin Stevie's Australia- Just want to Be Friends CD
description:
TN.19 Screamin Stevie’s Australia
Just Want to Be Friends CD
Screamin Stevie's Australia's  and their debut nine track album  Just Want to be Friends  will win friends across all genre barriers and divides. Encompassing Garage to blues to Psychedelia and beyond, all with his trademark organ grinding away. Since the hiatus of his previous group The Credit Union Stevie has assembled a group featuring Brian Mann on guitar ( Screaming Tribesmen & The Headstones) jack Mulroney on Bass (Purple Avengers) and Russell on drums and percussion( Mystery of Sixes). They have come together within the last 18 months playing with likes of The Stems, Pineapples From the Dawn of Time, Mick Hadley and the Others and Eddy Current Suppression Ring.

Track List
1.12 Hours a day
2.Rockin soul
3.She Just Wants To Be Friends
4.You Know that I Love You
5.I Like it
6.Twisted Twist
7.Touch The Sky
8.Long Gone
9.Done Me Wrong

name: Various - Artists Drunks Guns and Livestock in the Streets Vol2. CD
description:
TN.05 Various Artists Drunks Guns and Livestock in the Streets 2 CD

The Masked Wrestling Years This is the second of the series that takes in the blood bath once known as the Turkeyneck bar and grill. this comp collects rare recordings from some of australias most endearing and notorious from the last 25 years from the Johnnys to the Leftovers and everything in between. Rupture covering X's hate city has to be one australias most brutal rock'n'roll covers ever put to record.
